comments:
To reproduce, follow the instructions below:

1) Click on file -> new -> example...
2) Select Apache Commons Logging Sample -> next -> finish
3) Try running the HyadesLoggingCommonsSample class in profiling mode with the 'Agent Discoverer' data collector selected.  Notice that the following error message is outputted to the console:

ERROR - HyadesLoggingCommonsSample unsuccessfully ended!
REASON: org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.FileLogger incompatible with org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.Logger
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.FileLogger incompatible with org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.Logger
	at HyadesLoggingCommonsSample.main(HyadesLoggingCommonsSample.java:97)


The same result is observed with both IAC and standalone AC.  This works fine if an older Agent Controller is used.

Paul, I added one line of code at the HyadesLoggingCommonsSample.main()
System.setProperty("org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory", "org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.LoggerFactory");

Could you please help me to do the code review?

Thanks

(In reply to comment #3)
> Paul, I added one line of code at the HyadesLoggingCommonsSample.main()
> System.setProperty("org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory",
> "org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.LoggerFactory");
> 
> Could you please help me to do the code review?
> 
> Thanks
> 

Patch reviewed.

Can you change 2005,2006,2007 to 2005,2007 and capitalize the first letter in your comment.

I would be interested to know why this symptom is now being seen.  Did the Apache Commons Logging version change?
yes, a new apahce common jar is packaged in TPTP4_4

(In reply to comment #5)
> yes, a new apahce common jar is packaged in TPTP4_4
> 

Could this be a behavioral change in Apache Commons Logging?  I would recommend consulting the Apache Commons Logging documentation for the release we ship to see if this is environment setting is now required.
